background.post_Lenin_power_vacuum: Struggle for power following Lenin's death in 1924
background.Stalin_rise_to_power: Triumph over political opponents and control of the party by 1928
background.Kirov_assassination: Led to an investigation revealing a network of party members working against Stalin

Moscow_trials.description: Show trials of leading Bolshevik party members

operations.ethnic_operations: Targeted certain ethnic minorities with forced deportation and repression
operations.military_purge: Removal of Red Army and military high command, significantly impacting military capabilities

impact.political: Elimination of perceived threats to Stalin's power and silencing of political dissent
impact.social: Widespread fear and mistrust among the populace, decimation of the intelligentsia and cultural figures
impact.military: Weakening of military leadership and capabilities

aftermath.Stalin_reversal: 1938 declaration that internal enemies had been removed, criticism of NKVD's methods
aftermath.long_term_effects: Continuation of atmosphere of mistrust and surveillance, impact on Soviet society and governance

memorials_and_rehabilitation.post_Stalin_denouncement: Denounced by Nikita Khrushchev and subsequent rehabilitation of many victims
memorials_and_rehabilitation.memorials: Mass graves turned into memorial sites, recognition of the crimes of the Soviet regime
